content.description:
We stopped here on a cross-country roadtrip at the recommendation of several locals, including Dick Dower, who discovered this area and had a good time climbing with our two small children. After doing all the established problems and not wanting to quite get back in the car, I played around with this traverse along the base. 

 Sit start on the far left side and work your way rightward, staying low (below the juggy shelf/break below the overhang). This can be made harder or easier depending on which holds you decide are "on" or not. In general I found the rock to be a bit more solid than the topouts on all the other established problems and so ended up doing it several times (including right to left) before we moved on. Top out on the right side, either via D'Horn or D1.
content.location: This boulder sits close to Lake of the Woods behind the back entrance to the Zoo. This is a left-to-right traverse across the front of the entire boulder.

content.description: A single boulder with a few problems on it located near the backside of the zoo (employee entrance)
